title: If I recorded an album of cover songs and 'sold' it for free, would I have to obtain permission from the songwriter(s)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you will almost certainly be sued, for you have stolen someone else’s intellectual property. What you do with that song, whether you profit from its release or not, is not an issue. The songwriter can still call you out for theft or unauthorized use of a musical creation. Let’s take an example from the literary world. If I discovered a batch of previously unpublished letters written by Ernest Hemingway and promised to only put them on display at the New York City Public Library the Hemingway estate could still sue me for using his writings without permission.

It's all down to “performing rights” …. It's a complicated business which is difficult to enforce but having your name on the album and taking credit for it would make it easy to track you down and Sue you
